TopicTitle: Interstellar transfer between multiple star systems

Articles.Content: How would a spacecraft travel between 2 stars in a binary star system? With a normal hohmann transfer just like a planet and a moon?

Only some interplanetary transfers are near-Hohmann. At greater distances (generally to Jupiter and beyond) our probes use faster transfers because Hohmann transfer just takes too long.

In the same way, transfers between stars in a binary system could use different trajectories depending on the relative sizes and distances of the stars, the propellant budget, maximum available thrust, initial orbit, expected failure rate of spacecraft components, possible time-critical mission objectives, and the availability of planets for gravitational assist. Probably more things I haven't thought of as well.
